alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 23 at 9:56AM EST until December 25 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 PM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph tonight. A rapid switch from rain to snow with sharply falling temperatures into the teens and single digits will result in a flash freeze this afternoon. Blizzard conditions will develop late this afternoon lasting into Sunday morning. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...Jefferson county. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 1 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be extremely difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage and numerous power outages. The bitter wind chills as low as 10 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Strong winds will cause significant blowing and drifting snow, frequently reducing visibilities to zero. Travel is strongly discouraged.
